* Zyber rests her head on her knees as she watches the flames of the fire, 
the water almost at a boil.
The first tiny bubble begin to form on the bottom of the bowl before she 
suddenly hears this hellish noise from behind her, scrambing to her feet and 
whipping around only to see her guest awake.
Her spark was racing and she could seel the blood rush to her head from the 
surprise, then gasping as the great beast fell to the floor.
Zyber didn't waste a moment before she was by the strange creatures side, 
moving her arms over his heavy back and chest.*

" Careful, do not move. You are still fairly damaged."

* She then looked him over quickly to see if he had any other damage that 
she didn't know about. Which there was none.
Zyber sighed in reliefe and then put all of her strength into lifting the 
great bulk of this bot into a sitting position.
After a fair amount of sweat and muscle strain she mannaged to do so, 
slumping against the beasts chest for a moment to catch her breath.
The smell of the salve was strong in her nose before she sat up with a groan 
and a sigh, her tired and stressed muscles aching.
Zyber kept her hands on the beasts shoulders to make sure that he sat up, 
then looked up into his face.*

" I rubbed...a salve into your chest. It's meant to clear your lungs and 
wake you up. And...I see...it worked."

* She then gently pushed his shoulders back so that he could rest his back 
against the head-board of her bed, taking the strain off his muscles it took 
to keep him sitting up...and the strain off her shoulders that it took to 
keep him from falling on her.*

" Relax. I am no harm to you."

* Zyber then looked back towards the tea, then looked back towards the 
strange creature.*

" Think you could drink something?"
